{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3534795,"name":"IBOTS 2370","username":"IBOTS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ibots/{size}/240421_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T22:53:58.536Z","cooked":"

We are running into problems implementing Path Planner 2025 with our swerve drive. When running a completely straight path with no rotation our robot follows it properly. However when any rotational value is added to the path, it starts to spin aggressively - not following the path in any way that is show in path planner. We have tried multiple adjustments and read through documentation without finding a solution. We would appreciate any suggestions or feedback on fixing our code. You can find our code here on github: GitHub - FRCTeam2370/2025BaseSwerveCode: This is all of the working functional Swerve Code that should be used as a base for all robots this year.

Here are videos of what is happening

Thank you for any support or suggestions that you can provide.

I had something similar happen to me in the off-season. In the video you see the robot is turning the wrong way (relatively to the path). The more the error is the crazier it gets.

I believe your rotational velocity (your omega) is of the wrong sign.

You may not notice that in teleop driving because you may have also negated your teleop driving omega, which makes the behavior seem normal (thats what happened in our case).

I would say look through the code for that - our fix was simply to negate our desired chassis speeds omega value before sending it to the modules. It looks weird when you look at pathplanner telemetry (the robots desired angular velocity appears negative) but odometry and everything else work fine.

Make sure to look at your teleop controlled driving code as well and negate the rotation where necessary.

I hope this helps!

(P.S. congrats on getting to Einstein last year! Hope you guys make it again this year)

I think my team experienced this issue. If you are in very dire straits, try negative PID constants (this worked for us BUT is very cursed so only do in case of emergency). After a day, this issue inexplicably vanished for us.

Thank you so much for your quick reply and suggestions. We implemented the suggestion - but it wasn’t enough to fully fix the issue. We had to make some additional changes but were finally able to get it working.

We fixed the problem with the following changes to our code:

  • Added PID controller for rotation - set to enabled continuous input
  • Increased translation PID in the PathPlanner Holonomic controller
  • Made our omega radians per second negative and divided by 3.1 to determine the max rotational velocity

Thank you again for your quick response and helpful suggestion. Thank you for your kind comments about World’s. We were so honored to be there with our alliance partners. Hope you have a great season too!
